Node.id: More rules on progressing w/ the ball

Item.id: when a player wants to advance the ball by dribbling, he may begin a dribble by tossing the ball into the air touching it again before it hits the floor, thereafter it must always touch the floor before he touches it again.

Node.Node: <Node id="to reach to the stage of touching the ball w/ both hands (i.e. ==> ending the dribble), the player must stop by taking 2 steps/dumm" alignment="2" arrowcolor="-3407668" arrowsize="1" backgroundcolor="-1" foregroundcolor="-16777216" initialexpanded="0" linecolor="-3407668" linesize="1" fontsize="1"> <Item id="one w/ each foot/dumm" alignment="1" arrowcolor="-16776961" arrowsize="1" backgroundcolor="-1" foregroundcolor="-16777216" initialexpanded="0" linecolor="-16776961" linesize="1" fontsize="1">

Node.id: rules for stopping then pivoting when carring the ball

Node: <Node id="these rules are defined by a 2 count ryt" alignment="1" arrowcolor="-3355648" arrowsize="1" backgroundcolor="-1" foregroundcolor="-16777216" initialexpanded="0" linecolor="-3355648" linesize="2" fontsize="1"> <Node id="rule 1" alignment="1" arrowcolor="-3355648" arrowsize="1" backgroundcolor="-1" foregroundcolor="-16777216" initialexpanded="0" linecolor="-3355648" linesize="1" fontsize="1">

<Node id="A player who receives the ball while standing still, or who comes to a legal stop while holding the ball may/dummy" alignment="1" arrowcolor="-3355648" arrowsize="1" backgroundcolor="-1" foregroundcolor="-16777216" initialexpanded="0" linecolor="-3355648" linesize="1" fontsize="1"> <Item id="lift the pivot foot OR jump when he throws for goal or passes, but the ball must leave his hands before one or both feet again touch the floor. /dumm" alignment="1" arrowcolor="-16776961" arrowsize="1" backgroundcolor="-1" foregroundcolor="-16777216" initialexpanded="0" linecolor="-16776961" linesize="1" fontsize="1"> <Item id="not lift the pivot foot, in starting a dribble before the ball leaves his hands. /dumm" alignment="1" arrowcolor="-16776961" arrowsize="1" backgroundcolor="-1" foregroundcolor="-16777216" initialexpanded="0" linecolor="-16776961" linesize="1" fontsize="1">

Item.id: the player receives the ball if either foot is is touching the floor at the time he receives it. OR
either foot touches the floor simultaneously after he receives the ball, if both feet are off the floor when he receives it.
2nd count occurs when (after count of one) either foot touches the floor or both feet touch the floor simultaneously.
Note ==> when a player comes to a legal stop, if one foot is in advance of the other, he may pivot, but only on the one count foot (usually the rear).
